meanings.definition: To leave someone or something behind in a race or competition.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah can easily outdistance the tortoise in a race.
meanings.sent2: The Olympic sprinter managed to outdistance all her competitors in the 100-meter dash.
meanings.sent3: The hare tried to outdistance the tortoise, but ended up taking a nap instead.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed allowed her to outdistance her previous track record.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship's speed outdistanced anything ever seen on Earth.

meanings.definition: To surpass or exceed in distance or achievement.
meanings.sent1: His generosity towards others always manages to outdistance everyone else's.
meanings.sent2: The student's hard work and dedication helped her outdistance her classmates in academic achievements.
meanings.sent3: The race car driver tried to outdistance his own speed record but couldn't quite make it.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for painting allowed her to outdistance her peers in artistic skill.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner's endurance outdistanced all expectations, leading him to victory.
